¿Tienes un posgrado? Estos son los empleos que más los demandan

Un estudio de Adecco revela que estas titulaciones pueden ser clave para encontrar el primer trabajo y facilitar la mejora profesional para quienes ya tienen experiencia laboral.

Dentro de la alta competencia por conseguir un puesto laboral, poseer un posgrado puede marcar la diferencia, aunque en España aún no sea un requisito obligatorio. En igualdad de condiciones entre candidatos, esta titulación puede ser el elemento diferenciador que desequilibre la balanza, según indica el estudio realizado por Spring Professional -perteneciente a Adecco- e Infoempleo.

El estudio señala que, si bien en España solo 2 de cada 100 ofertas de empleo demandan esta titulación, para las personas sin experiencia laboral puede ser la llave para conseguir el primer empleo. "La formación de posgrado es importante para diferenciarse de los demás candidatos, pero sobre todo demuestra competencias y aptitudes que orientan al seleccionador sobre el perfil del entrevistado: cultura de esfuerzo, voluntad de aprender, entre otras", explica Alexandra Andrade, directora nacional de Spring Professional.

Para quienes cuentan con experiencia laboral, tener un posgrado puede impulsar su carrera profesional hacia puestos de mayor responsabilidad. De hecho, en el último año las ofertas para puestos directivos que incluyen un posgrado como requisito han aumentado un 15%.

En el mercado laboral español, ciertos sectores requieren especialmente una titulación superior. Las empresas de asesoría jurídica son las que más las valoran: el 19,9% de sus ofertas de empleo incluye este requisito. Le sigue el sector de internet con un 16,9%, cifra que se ha cuadruplicado en un año. Otros sectores donde frecuentemente se requiere un posgrado son consultoría, ingeniería, investigación e información y asesoramiento.

I never believed in an afterlife or God. Church was foreign to me, and faith seemed impossible given the endless suffering I'd endured. How could there be a God in such a cruel world? A world where a mother dies giving birth to her only son. A world where a grief-stricken father, drowning in alcohol and memories of his dead wife, is allowed to keep custody of a child.

CPS turned a blind eye to the bruises and the squalid living conditions—a barren apartment without a single toy. Instead of playthings, I found companionship in torturing the insects that infested our cramped home. At school, other children shunned me for my oversized thrift store clothes, purchased only during 75% off sales when pickings were slim. During recess, while others played together, I sat alone in the mud, finding solace among the worms and ants.

Perhaps it was inevitable that "bug boy" would become an exterminator. My career expanded beyond insects to include rats, raccoons, and the occasional possum. Who expected more? Certainly not my father—he died before I established myself. His final request still haunts me: asking for a ride to the hospital, clutching his chest, his skin and eyes yellowed with disease. He held my mother's pre-wedding photograph as he made his plea. I snatched the photo and left him there to die on that couch.

I found myself in New York City with nothing but twenty dollars and a few dirty clothes. After struggling to find work, I discovered extermination—a profession in high demand requiring minimal training. Every day brought new challenges: apartment complexes, high-rise offices, even million-dollar Brooklyn brownstones. No place was immune to pests, and I reveled in it. Initially, I got a thrill from the killing—bugs, rats, whatever came my way. But eventually, even suffocating a family of rats in a plastic bag left me feeling nothing.

When pest control no longer satisfied my darker urges, I convinced myself to pursue "bigger prey." I had saved enough money from years of relentless work to sustain myself for months. I decided to start small—a child. At the park, I spotted my target: a young girl, perhaps six or seven, seemingly alone. I rushed across the street and grabbed her, trying to muffle her screams as I headed toward my van.

"HELP, MOM! MOMMY!"

As I glanced back to check if anyone had noticed, I heard a car horn. A truck slammed into me, and everything went black.

I awakened instantly, feeling weightless, as if floating on a cloud. As I struggled to my feet, a thunderous voice boomed from above:

"NOW LET THE GAMES BEGIN!"

Cheers echoed around me as massive gates swung open. A torrent of creatures—rats, possums, roaches, ants, raccoons, mice, pigeons, and spiders—charged toward me. They overwhelmed me, covering my body, biting and crawling into my ears. As I screamed in agony, my final vision before losing consciousness was of my parents tearing at my throat.

# The Four Powers

When Bill awakens one afternoon—as is his habit to sleep late—the day seems like any other dreary Wednesday. With evening plans to play soccer with old friends, he hurries through his meal, grabs his worn soccer shoes and favorite ball, and heads out.

At the field, an eager Bill urges his friends to start the game. Through rock-paper-scissors, he's assigned as goalkeeper, and the two three-person teams take their positions. As the match begins with a powerful kick, Bill faces his first real challenge—a shot on goal. As he braces for the save, something extraordinary happens: the ball inexplicably changes direction mid-flight, veering off to the side. Everyone, including Bill, stands dumbfounded.

For the next half hour, Bill deflects every shot with this mysterious ability. Unable to explain his newfound power to his bewildered friends, he returns home to experiment. He discovers he can alter the trajectory of any airborne object at will—a power both puzzling and intriguing.

The following day brings an impossible sight: a massive snowstorm in the middle of August, in a typically warm region. Bill attempts to control the weather, wondering if his powers have expanded, but fails. He considers that perhaps someone else in town possesses supernatural abilities—after all, if an ordinary person like him could gain powers, why not others?

His routine is interrupted by an unexpected visit from two police officers, who take him in for questioning due to a case of mistaken identity—another Bill with the same surname lives in the city. After several hours of interrogation, they release him, adding to the day's strange events.

The next day, while shopping for headphones, Bill encounters four menacing men in leather jackets who drag him into a dark alley. Armed with knives and guns, they threaten him. In a shocking moment, Bill's right index finger transforms into a gun barrel. He quickly disarms the knife-wielders and deflects the bullets fired at him, striking his attackers. The same police officers from the previous day appear and arrest everyone involved.

Spending the night in jail, Bill finds himself in one of five conveniently empty cells, separated from his attackers. Come morning, the other inmates begin a cacophonous singing competition. Bill joins in with his favorite song, singing louder than the rest. Suddenly, silence falls over the station.

Hours pass without any sign of the guards. Using his gun-finger, Bill breaks free only to discover a horrifying scene: everyone in the station lies dead. In town, he sees a street musician performing the same song he had sung, and the terrible truth dawns on him—his singing had killed everyone within earshot.

After thirty years of perceived injustice, this newfound power of death awakens something dark in Bill. He embarks on a vengeful rampage through town, his deadly song claiming countless lives. Hours later, exhausted, he rests on a park bench. In his final moment, he looks up to see a piano plummeting from the sky—a fatal reminder of the probability-warping power that had caused the snowstorm.

Thus ends the tale of Bill and his four powers: Trajectory Curving, Probability Modification, Gun Protrusion, and the Death Song.

现年36岁的谭宏进已在美国居住13年。他毕业于南京大学物理系，之后取得加州理工学院博士学位。谭的专业领域包括“可再生能源存储材料和系统开发”。他于2018年12月被捕，因涉嫌窃取商业机密而面临指控。谭承认曾从美国一家石油公司盗取价值超过10亿美元的下一代电池技术。

从2017年5月到2018年12月，谭在俄克拉荷马州巴特尔斯维尔的Phillips 66公司担任科学家，参与开发用于固定式能量存储的下一代电池技术，尤其是液流电池。根据报道，2018年12月11日，谭使用U盘复制了数百份公司文件。次日，他辞去了工作，并在2018年12月12日被护送离开公司。当天稍晚，他归还了U盘，并称自己离开时忘记归还。然而，经检查发现，U盘中存在未分配的空间，表明此前有五个文件被删除。

联邦调查局（FBI）的调查人员在搜查谭的住所时，发现了一个外部硬盘驱动器。进一步调查显示，U盘中被删除的五个文件已被下载到硬盘中。谭将这些文件保存在硬盘中，显然是为了日后访问，然而，这一行为对其前雇主造成了重大的财务损失。

Modern vehicular networks have revolutionized intelligent ground transportation systems. Through advanced communication technologies, automobiles now connect seamlessly with various elements—vehicles, pedestrians, infrastructure, roads, and cloud computing platforms—creating an interconnected ecosystem. This integration has given rise to V2X (vehicle-to-everything) communications.

V2X technology leverages the latest networking advances to enable multiple connection types:
- Vehicle-to-vehicle (V2V)
- Vehicle-to-infrastructure (V2I)
- Vehicle-to-pedestrian (V2P)
- Vehicle-to-cloud (V2C)

These connections (illustrated in Fig. 1) promise significant benefits, including improved traffic efficiency, reduced accidents and pollution, and optimized resource utilization [1], [2]. Common V2X applications encompass [1]-[4]:
- Road safety (traffic incident reporting, collision warning and avoidance)
- Cooperative automated driving
- Infotainment services (traffic information systems)

However, like all sophisticated connected computing platforms, enhanced vehicular computing capabilities increase vulnerability exposure and potential attack surfaces. While V2X communication aims to provide robust and resilient transportation infrastructure, it introduces new security challenges. For instance, a malicious vehicle could broadcast false information about road conditions—such as fabricated traffic jams or accidents—forcing other vehicles to unnecessarily alter their behavior through slowdowns or rerouting.

Attack detection and mitigation are crucial for widely deployed V2X systems, particularly considering that attackers may gain physical access to system components. Breaches in vehicular communication systems can result in:
- Data loss
- Component failure
- Infrastructure damage
- Environmental impact

To address these concerns, each vehicle is equipped with an on-board unit (OBU)—an in-vehicle communication interface that connects with the vehicular control system and manages external communications with other entities (vehicles, RSUs, etc.). Given these security implications, protecting V2X communication platforms is paramount for the successful design, implementation, and widespread deployment of this technology.

Se présentera-t-il ou non ? Manuel Valls accentue la pression sur François Hollande concernant l'élection présidentielle de 2017. Dans un entretien accordé au Journal du Dimanche, le Premier ministre n'exclut pas de se présenter contre lui à la primaire du PS. « Face au désarroi, au doute, à la déception, à l'idée que la gauche n'a aucune chance, je veux briser cette mécanique qui nous conduirait à la défaite », explique-t-il lorsqu'on l'interroge sur la capacité d'une candidature de François Hollande à créer une dynamique.

Interrogé sur la possibilité d'être candidat à la primaire face au chef de l'État, comme l'a suggéré Claude Bartolone, président de l'Assemblée nationale, Manuel Valls répond au JDD : « Chacun doit mener ses réflexions en responsabilité. Je prendrai ma décision en conscience. Quoi qu'il arrive, le sens de l'État m'animera toujours. » Compte tenu de l'échéance imposée – les candidats à la primaire du PS ont jusqu'au 15 décembre pour se déclarer – sa décision « est une question de jours », précise-t-il.

Sur la question de sa loyauté, le Premier ministre affirme : « J'entretiens des rapports de respect, d'amitié et de loyauté avec le Président. Mais la loyauté n'exclut pas la franchise. Force est de constater que ces dernières semaines, le contexte a évolué. La parution du livre de confidences [Un président ne devrait pas dire ça, NDLR] a créé un profond désarroi à gauche. En tant que chef de la majorité, ma responsabilité est donc de tenir compte de ce climat. »

Il poursuit : « Je n'oublie pas que le président a été élu par les Français en 2012. Mais toute candidature doit prendre en compte la relation avec les Français, avec la gauche et avec notre famille politique. Toute décision qui négligerait l'une de ces trois dimensions apparaîtrait comme bancale ou fragile. Pour ma part, j'intègre constamment ces trois éléments. »

La primaire du PS, prévue les 22 et 29 janvier, « doit insuffler un élan, de l'espoir », déclare Manuel Valls, qui après s'être longtemps opposé à ce scrutin, juge désormais « impensable » son abandon, pourtant évoqué par certains soutiens de François Hollande.

# From Parking to Paradise: A Parisian Garage Transformed

In the heart of metropolitan Paris, where residential space comes at a premium, interior designers Céline Pelcé and Géraud Pellottiero of Atelier Pelpell have achieved something remarkable. They've transformed an ordinary parking garage into an extraordinary 700-square-foot home for a family of four, proving that innovative design can triumph over spatial constraints.

## Preserving Heritage While Embracing Modernity

The designers made the bold choice to retain key architectural elements of the original structure—exposed concrete beams, ramps, and vaults—lending authenticity and character to the space. Their primary challenge lay in maximizing natural light, as the structure originally featured just a single wall of windows.

## Ingenious Storage Solutions

Perhaps the most impressive aspect of this transformation is the integration of nearly 70 cleverly concealed storage spaces within the walls, ceilings, and floors. Storage corridors line the entrance and hallway between living areas and bedrooms, ensuring every square inch serves a purpose.

As Pelcé explains, "With a single contribution of natural light from the windowed facade facing street, the apartment is designed to be 'turned' toward this light with its glass rooms. Elements holding the old garage function were kept as witnesses and graphic structures of the apartment."

## Custom-Crafted Interiors

Local artisans collaborated with Atelier Pelpell to create 80% of the apartment's furniture. Highlights include:
- A kitchen island featuring a built-in extendable dining table
- A space-saving curved sliding door for the master bedroom
- Bedrooms oriented toward the window wall to maximize natural light
- A multi-functional children's alcove that doubles as toy storage
- A mezzanine loft accessible by ladder, featuring both double and single beds

## Thoughtful Details

The bathroom showcases a sophisticated blend of colored glass and black tiles, accommodating both a generous bathtub and shower. Select pieces from prestigious brands complement the custom furnishings:
- Press Citron shelving in the living room
- TOGO sofas from Ligne Roset
- A statement yellow chair by Desormeaux-Carrette
- BALLROOM lamps from NORDKRAFT
- Elegant wallpaper by Belgian brand Tenue de Ville

This transformation stands as a testament to the power of innovative design, proving that with vision and creativity, even the most utilitarian spaces can become extraordinary homes.

La Protectora de Animales de Alicante, adjudicataria del servicio de recogida de animales municipal, alberga actualmente a doce perros potencialmente peligrosos. La institución se dedica a reeducarlos y socializarlos para facilitar su adopción por familias responsables.

La concejal de Protección Animal, Marisa Gayo, afirma que la mayoría de estos ejemplares son "buenos y cariñosos", aunque han sido injustamente "estigmatizados". Como ejemplo, menciona el caso de Red, un american stanford que permanece en la Protectora desde hace más de tres años sin encontrar un hogar.

Los doce perros, todos ellos de razas pitbull y american stanford, fueron requisados por la Unidad Canina de la Policía Local debido a que sus anteriores dueños carecían de la licencia reglamentaria. La edil destaca que ninguno de estos animales tiene antecedentes de agresión.

"Si bien es cierto que son perros con gran potencia mandibular y física en general, su comportamiento depende fundamentalmente de la educación que reciban", explica Gayo.

Mar Castillo, representante de la entidad, describe cómo los voluntarios de la Protectora trabajan diariamente con estos perros: los pasean, conviven con ellos y los relacionan con otros perros e incluso gatos para evaluar sus reacciones y comportamiento. "La mayoría son dóciles y perfectamente capaces de convivir con familias y otros perros. Por ejemplo, Red y Tuerti -un pitbull tuerto que fue abandonado- comparten jaula con otros perros sin presentar problema alguno", señala Castillo.

Reconoce que algunos casos son más complejos y requieren alojamiento individual. "Hemos tenido rottweilers que fueron adoptados por familias que posteriormente nos han visitado para confirmar su excelente adaptación. Sin embargo, basta mencionar la palabra pitbull para que la gente reaccione como si se tratara del demonio", añade.

# Coventry Foodbank Receives Major Donation from Retail Exhibition

Over five tons of food will help feed hungry residents across Coventry and surrounding areas, following a successful collection at a major retail exhibition.

The massive haul came as the Nisa Annual Exhibition 2019 concluded earlier this month at the NAEC Stoneleigh. Coventry Foodbank collected 5.5 tons of surplus food from the event, with 4.5 tons going directly to their reserves. The remaining ton was distributed to other local organizations including Leamington/Warwick Foodbank, Langar Aid, Anesis, and Nuneaton Oasis.

Hugh McNeill, project manager at Coventry Foodbank, expressed his gratitude towards Nisa: "We would once again like to thank Nisa for their ongoing support. The Nisa Expo event has now become a regular part of our year and all our volunteers really look forward to it."

He explained the significant impact of the donation: "By allowing us to collect the surplus food from Stoneleigh, we are able to work with various charities in supporting some of the most vulnerable people in our city. This includes those who are homeless, in temporary accommodation, families struggling to make ends meet, people with disabilities and mental health issues, and single parents trying to cope with the demands of life."

El trágico suceso ocurrió durante la mañana en las instalaciones de la Secretaría de Educación de Brasilia, donde la víctima, Débora Tereza Correia, desempeñaba sus funciones.

Brasil cuenta con una robusta legislación para proteger a las mujeres contra la violencia. La Ley María da Penha de 2006, nombrada en honor a una mujer que quedó parapléjica tras un intento de asesinato por parte de su esposo, endureció las penas para agresores domésticos —donde según expertos ocurre la mayoría de los ataques— y estableció refugios para las víctimas. Hace tres años se aprobó otra ley contra los feminicidios, aumentando las penas cuando se demuestra que el crimen fue motivado por odio de género.

No obstante, la violencia persiste como un problema grave. Durante el año anterior, 1.173 mujeres fueron víctimas de feminicidios, según datos del Foro Brasileño de Seguridad Pública.

Michele dos Ramos, especialista en violencia de género del Instituto Igarapé, señala que, pese a los avances legislativos recientes, Brasil mantiene "una fuerte cultura machista" que fomenta la violencia. Según estadísticas de la ONU publicadas en 2016, el país sudamericano ocupa el quinto lugar mundial en tasa de feminicidios, con 4,8 muertes por cada 100.000 habitantes.

La especialista advierte que la reciente flexibilización de las normas para portar y poseer armas de fuego, impulsada por el presidente Jair Bolsonaro, podría agravar la situación. "La experiencia estadounidense demuestra una correlación significativa entre el aumento de la circulación de armas y el incremento de feminicidios", explicó.

# COVID-19 : La Grande-Bretagne lance sa campagne de vaccination

## Une première mondiale dans la lutte contre la pandémie

Le Royaume-Uni a débuté mardi l'administration du vaccin Pfizer-BioNTech contre le coronavirus, marquant une avancée majeure dans la vaccination des populations à risque et la lutte mondiale contre la pandémie.

## Caractéristiques principales du vaccin Pfizer-BioNTech

### Une efficacité remarquable de 95%

- Le 9 novembre : Pfizer annonce une efficacité supérieure à 90% lors des essais de phase 3
- Le 20 novembre : L'efficacité finale atteint 95%
- Résultats des essais cliniques :
  - 43 000 volontaires participants
  - 170 cas de Covid-19 recensés
  - Seulement 8 cas parmi les vaccinés contre 162 dans le groupe placebo

### Une technologie innovante à ARN messager

Le vaccin utilise une approche novatrice basée sur l'ARN messager (ARNm) :
- Développement rapide grâce à la seule nécessité de la séquence génétique du virus
- Utilisation d'un fragment de la protéine de spicule du coronavirus
- Production par l'organisme d'une partie spécifique de la protéine virale
- Déclenchement d'une réponse immunitaire protective

### Contraintes de conservation

- Température de stockage requise : environ -75°C
- Nécessité d'équipements spéciaux pour le transport et le stockage
- Protection par nanoparticules lipidiques en raison de la fragilité de l'ARNm

## Déploiement international

### Au Royaume-Uni

- Approbation le 2 décembre par la MHRA
- Mise en œuvre immédiate du programme de vaccination
- Organisation basée sur l'expérience du NHS en matière de vaccination à grande échelle

### Au Mexique

- Accord pour 34,4 millions de doses
- Première livraison prévue : 250 000 doses
- Priorité au personnel soignant en première ligne

### Aux États-Unis

- Demande d'autorisation d'urgence (EUA) déposée le 20 novembre
- Réunion du comité consultatif de la FDA prévue du 8 au 10 décembre
- Possible disponibilité pour les populations à risque dès mi-décembre

## Points importants à retenir

- Premier vaccin à demander une approbation réglementaire aux États-Unis
- Développement réalisé en 248 jours
- L'autorisation d'urgence (EUA) diffère d'une approbation complète
- Moderna suit avec un vaccin similaire présentant 94,5% d'efficacité

Los once distritos de Málaga vuelven a acoger, del 24 de junio al 11 de agosto, el cine de verano organizado por el Ayuntamiento a través del Festival de Málaga. El programa Cine Abierto ofrecerá 119 proyecciones gratuitas en 21 espacios distintos de la ciudad.

El anuncio fue realizado conjuntamente por el alcalde, Francisco de la Torre; la concejala de Cultura del Ayuntamiento, Gemma del Corral; el director de Área de Negocio de Málaga en representación de Obra Social "la Caixa", Jesús Vega; y el director del Festival de Málaga, Juan Antonio Vigar.

Esta iniciativa de cine estival, que en su edición anterior congregó a más de 65.000 malagueños, se mantiene presente en todos los distritos de la ciudad como parte del proyecto global de difusión cinematográfica que el Festival de Málaga desarrolla durante todo el año.

Como novedad destacada, Cine Abierto 2017 presenta el ciclo 'Abierto al español', que se exhibirá en el Cine Albéniz y en el recinto Eduardo Ocón. Este ciclo comprende ocho proyecciones en total, distribuidas equitativamente entre películas iberoamericanas y españolas.

El programa se extiende también a Muelle Uno, donde se realizarán tres proyecciones, al igual que en la plaza de Tabacalera, estas últimas en colaboración con la Colección del Museo Ruso de San Petersburgo-Málaga.

En cuanto a la accesibilidad, siguiendo la iniciativa del año anterior, se programarán dos sesiones con subtítulos para personas sordas en la plaza Esperanza, ubicada en calle Lagunillas.

En términos numéricos, Cine Abierto 2017 ofrecerá 119 sesiones distribuidas en 21 espacios diferentes. De estas, 34 tendrán lugar en el Cine Albéniz y las 85 restantes se repartirán entre las playas (31 proyecciones) y los parques y espacios abiertos de la ciudad (54 proyecciones).

La programación incluye 29 títulos diferentes, que comprenden ocho películas de producción o coproducción española, cuatro iberoamericanas, quince estadounidenses, una francesa y una rusa.

# Online Matching in Strategic Settings: A Comprehensive Analysis

## Introduction and Background

Matching in bipartite graphs has emerged as a fundamental model with numerous Internet-era applications, including:
- E-commerce (items and buyers)
- Ride-sharing platforms (drivers and passengers)
- Online ad auctions (ad slots and advertisers)
- Online labor markets (jobs and workers)

In these applications, one side of vertices is known from the start, while the other side arrives sequentially online. As each online vertex arrives, its information (including adjacent edges and weights) is revealed, requiring immediate and irrevocable matching decisions.

## Classical Online Matching

A seminal result by Karp, Vazirani, and Vazirani demonstrates that in unweighted settings, their "Ranking" algorithm achieves an optimal competitive ratio of e/(e-1). This extends to scenarios where offline vertices are weighted, with the Perturbed-Greedy algorithm serving as a key solution.

## Strategic Considerations

While initially designed for non-strategic settings, online matching has increasingly been studied in contexts with strategic agents. This shift reflects real-world applications where parties may misreport valuations for better outcomes, such as:
- Combinatorial and ad-auctions
- Kidney exchange
- School-student matching
- House allocation

## The Strategic Challenge

In strategic settings, agents' values are private information unavailable to mechanism designers. This creates two key challenges:
1. Designing incentive-compatible (truthful) mechanisms
2. Determining appropriate payment structures

## A New Paradigm: Reversed Online Matching

Most previous research positioned agents on the online side. However, many Internet applications (like repeated ad auctions) feature fixed agents observing an online stream of items. This motivates studying reversed online matching, where:
- The strategic side is offline
- Items arrive online
- Agents have private information about values and desired items

## Dimensions of Analysis

Our systematic analysis considers multiple dimensions:

1. Agent Types:
   - Myopic: Limited to current time step considerations
   - Non-myopic: Optimize across multiple time steps

2. Private Information Scenarios:
   - Values only: Desired items are public
   - Values and preferences: Both values and desired items are private

3. Mechanism Types:
   - Prompt: Immediate payment decisions
   - Tardy: Delayed payment decisions

This structure presents the complex challenges of online matching in strategic settings while maintaining a clear progression from fundamental concepts to specific analytical dimensions.

# Découverte d'armes et de drogue à Saint-Denis : la mairie porte plainte

À Saint-Denis (93), une découverte inquiétante a été faite à l'Espace De Geyter, une maison de quartier fréquentée quotidiennement par des adolescents. Le mardi 8 octobre, lors d'un diagnostic amiante, un technicien a mis au jour un sac dissimulé dans le faux plafond contenant une arme de poing, une carabine, des seringues et une petite quantité d'héroïne.

La découverte s'est déroulée pendant la pause déjeuner des animateurs, qui ne font pour l'instant l'objet d'aucune suspicion ni mesure de suspension. L'origine du sac et la durée de sa dissimulation restent à déterminer.

Face à cette situation préoccupante, la municipalité a engagé deux actions :
- Le lancement d'une enquête administrative
- Le dépôt d'une plainte

Par mesure de précaution, l'Espace De Geyter, situé à proximité immédiate d'une école maternelle, demeure temporairement fermé pendant la fouille approfondie des locaux.

La mairie de Saint-Denis s'est exprimée sur son site internet : "Si le problème est connu, la drogue reste un poison qui touche durement notre commune. La découverte de stupéfiants, même en faible quantité, dans un établissement public est particulièrement choquante et grave. Plus que jamais, la lutte contre les trafics doit s'intensifier."

Cette découverte s'inscrit dans un contexte plus large de préoccupations liées aux stupéfiants à Saint-Denis.

**My Journey as a Seagoing Cowboy**

I worked at a grocery store until my friend Don Resit convinced me to go to Europe on a cattle boat. I knew immediately it was an offer I couldn't refuse—truly an opportunity of a lifetime. Being a Seagoing Cowboy opened the world to me, making me aware of people's needs in other countries. This awareness stayed with me, inspiring my family to help people internationally and support foreign visitors and students.

Would you want to cross the Atlantic? As a young boy, I experienced many adventures, traveling from the United States all the way to China.

Just before turning 18, I arrived in Greece! Beyond helping others, I enjoyed the benefit of exploring Europe, including touring a castle in Crete. Doesn't that sound exciting? If it does, consider becoming a Seagoing Cowboy.

There are many reasons to join this program. You can make a difference in people's lives, just as I did. You'll be grateful for this opportunity and find a renewed appreciation for life. Do you like animals? I fed them and helped raise them. There's never a dull moment—you'll stay busy throughout the journey.

The social life aboard ship is vibrant. You'll have fun with your fellow cowboys playing various games. Baseball and volleyball games take place in the empty holds where animals were previously housed. You can participate in table tennis tournaments in the kitchen or dining room. Other activities include fencing, boxing, reading, and whittling. These games helped make the time pass enjoyably.

My experience as a Seagoing Cowboy was transformative. I stayed active and formed lasting friendships. While there were occasional challenges, the opportunity my friend gave me proved invaluable. The experience led my family to dedicate ourselves to helping others—a true win-win situation.

What I'm about to tell you will sound insane.

I mean that literally. But please, hear me out. I promise it will make sense by the end. And if it doesn't? Well, you can judge me then. Time's running short, so I'll get to the point.

Remember that assassination attempt on the President three years ago? Of course, he wasn't President then—wasn't even the nominee. Nobody thought he had a chance. Two weeks before Super Tuesday, he was trailing by eighteen points, rambling about terrorism while everyone turned a deaf ear. Amazing how quickly that changed after the shooting. The election became a mere formality.

That was me. Not intentionally, but it was my doing. I wasn't even aiming for him—I was targeting his wife. His beautiful, perfect wife.

We met in college. She was the only woman I ever truly loved, and God, how I loved her. I never recovered. When I heard she'd married, I was devastated. Before her, I'd thought "heartache" was just a figure of speech.

The pain dulled eventually. I could think of her without crying or self-harm. I managed. Until her worthless husband decided to run for President. The media saw through him, but she... she was born for the campaign trail.

There was no escape. She was everywhere—on television, in magazines, on billboards along every street. Smiling. Watching. Haunting me. And it hurt.

Then one day, I broke. I can't explain it rationally. The pain became unbearable. So I bought a rifle. I disposed of it the next morning—threw it in the river—but I remember how it felt. The weight was comforting, like holding the child that should have been ours.

The rest was surprisingly simple. I'd always been a good shot, but I practiced. Walked into the hotel with a guitar case, like something from a movie. Hardly anyone noticed me. It seemed perfect.

But I missed. Of course I did. Instead of killing her, I hit her husband's shoulder. Overnight, he transformed from a conspiracy theorist into a visionary who'd bled for his beliefs.

# Netflix triomphe aux Emmy Awards avec « The Crown » et « Le Jeu de la Dame »

*Par SudOuest.fr avec AFP*  
*Publié le 20/09/2021 à 6h45*

## Le retour des Emmy Awards en présentiel

Les stars du petit écran se sont réunies dimanche à Los Angeles pour la première fois depuis le début de la pandémie sur le plateau des Emmy Awards, avec une jauge réduite à 500 invités triés sur le volet et des mesures sanitaires très strictes.

## Le triomphe historique de Netflix

La plateforme Netflix a obtenu dimanche la consécration qui lui échappait depuis tant d'années : sa production « The Crown » a décroché l'Emmy Award de la « meilleure série dramatique » et raflé tous les prix d'acteurs dans sa catégorie. Depuis son lancement en 2007, la plateforme de vidéo à la demande avait collectionné les nominations mais n'avait jamais remporté jusqu'à présent d'Emmy Award dans les catégories les plus prestigieuses.

### Les succès de "The Crown"

La quatrième saison de cette série très populaire, qui dépeint le mariage houleux entre la princesse Diana et le prince Charles, a particulièrement brillé :
- Olivia Colman a été sacrée meilleure actrice pour son rôle de la reine Elizabeth
- Josh O'Connor a remporté le prix du meilleur acteur
- Gillian Anderson a été récompensée pour son interprétation de Margaret Thatcher
- La série a également reçu des prix pour ses seconds rôles, le scénario et la réalisation

Une grande partie de l'équipe de « The Crown » n'avait pas pu faire le déplacement et suivait la remise des prix depuis Londres via une liaison satellite. Au total, la production Netflix a reçu onze Emmy Awards, à égalité avec « Le Jeu de la Dame » et à un trophée seulement du record établi par « Game of Thrones ».

## "Ted Lasso" domine la catégorie comédie

La comédie « Ted Lasso » d'Apple TV+ s'est imposée dans sa catégorie avec plusieurs récompenses majeures :
- Jason Sudeikis sacré meilleur acteur
- Hannah Waddingham et Brett Goldstein récompensés pour les seconds rôles
- Le titre de meilleure comédie

## Les autres temps forts de la soirée

### Mini-séries et performances individuelles
- Kate Winslet l'emporte face à Anya Taylor-Joy pour « Mare of Easttown »
- Jean Smart récompensée pour « Hacks »
- « Le Jeu de la Dame » de Netflix remporte le trophée de la meilleure mini-série

# 3D Single Object Tracking: A BEV-Based Approach

## Introduction

3D single object tracking (SOT) plays a vital role in applications like autonomous driving[1]-[3]. Its primary goal is to track a specific target across sequential point clouds, given only its initial state. Traditional tracking approaches[4],[5] typically rely on point-wise representation, processing raw point clouds directly.

### Current Approaches

Existing methods like P2B[4] and its successors[6]-[8] employ:
- A point-based Siamese network[9],[10] for feature extraction
- Point-wise appearance matching[4],[8],[11] for target cue propagation
- 3D Region Proposal Network[12],[13] for target localization

M2-Track[5] introduces a motion-centric paradigm that:
1. Segments target points from surroundings using PointNet[14]
2. Localizes the target through motion modeling and box refinement

## Limitations of Current Methods

While these approaches demonstrate strong performance, they face several challenges:
- Require complex architectural designs[8],[11],[15],[16]
- Need multiple subtask solutions[4],[5]
- Result in complicated tracking frameworks
- Present difficulties in hyper-parameter optimization

Notably, natural spatial continuity exists in object motion within video sequences[17],[18], but point-wise representations[9],[14] fail to leverage this valuable prior knowledge due to their irregular format.

## BEVTrack: A Novel Approach

We introduce BEVTrack, a streamlined yet powerful baseline for 3D SOT. By converting point clouds to Bird's Eye View (BEV) representation[19]-[21], BEVTrack effectively utilizes spatial information and inherently captures target motion patterns.

### Key Components

1. **Feature Extraction**: Employs a voxel-based Siamese network[19]
2. **BEV Conversion**: Compresses 3D features along the height dimension
3. **Feature Fusion**: Combines spatially adjacent objects across frames
4. **Target Localization**: Uses global max pooling and lightweight MLP

### Distribution-Aware Regression

Traditional regression-based trackers use L1 or L2 loss, assuming fixed Laplace or Gaussian distributions. We introduce a distribution-aware regression strategy that:
- Adapts to diverse target attributes (size, movement patterns, sparsity)
- Constructs likelihood functions based on learned distributions
- Improves performance without additional computational cost

*Working on a Horse Transport Ship: A Critical Perspective*

I believe working on a horse transport ship would be monotonous, as you'd repeatedly visit the same locations while seeing nothing but endless water. The vessel would likely smell like a barn, filled with the pungent odor of animals. The physical demands would be considerable—lifting heavy bales of straw and bags of oats, not to mention the constant cleaning required. As someone who owns two cats, I'm familiar with the challenges of animal care, from hauling pet food to cleaning up after them, especially when they're ill.

Managing 100 horses seems far from enjoyable unless you're particularly passionate about equines. Furthermore, working on a vessel during wartime would be perilous. The separation from family would be difficult, as bringing them aboard would likely be prohibited.

Consider the numerous potential challenges: seasickness, disease outbreaks among the horses, hull breaches, allergic reactions to various animals, engine failures, or food shortages. What about navigating through fog or darkness among icebergs with failed lighting systems? Medical emergencies—whether affecting humans or animals—would be particularly concerning, especially if illness spread through the crew.

In such scenarios, the horses' care would be compromised if the crew became too ill to work. The combination of these risks and challenges makes this occupation particularly daunting.

I certainly wouldn't choose such a demanding and hazardous profession!

A notable incident occurred at Mumbai's Mehboob Studios during the promotional events of "Tubelight" and "Jagga Jasoos." What transpired when Salman Khan unexpectedly entered a room where ex-couples Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif were conducting interviews? Let's delve into the details.

Observations of the cosmic microwave background (CMB) have yielded invaluable cosmological insights. The next generation of CMB surveys—including those from Simons Observatory [1], CCAT-prime [2], CMB-S4 [3], PICO [4], and CMB-HD [5]—will map the CMB with unprecedented precision. These advanced observations will not only provide enhanced sensitivity to primary CMB intensity and polarization fluctuations but will also enable more precise measurements of secondary CMB anisotropies [6].

Secondary CMB anisotropies arise from interactions between CMB photons and structures between our telescopes and the surface of last scattering. Key sources include:
- Weak gravitational lensing by large-scale structure [7]
- Various manifestations of the Sunyaev-Zel'dovich effect [8-12], describing Compton scattering between CMB photons and free electrons
- The integrated Sachs-Wolfe [13] and Rees-Sciama effects [14], which characterize how time-dependent gravitational potentials alter CMB photon energy
- The moving lens effect [15], where massive objects' transverse motion creates temperature fluctuations

Upcoming experiments should enable first-time detection of some of these effects [16-24]. These secondary anisotropies serve both as valuable sources of cosmological information and as potential sources of confusion when studying primary anisotropies.

Secondary anisotropies can be reconstructed by analyzing their impact on primary CMB fluctuation statistics. The primary CMB anisotropies are characterized by nearly Gaussian fluctuations, fully described by their power spectra C. Secondary anisotropies disrupt rotational invariance, create off-diagonal correlations between spherical harmonic coefficients, and render the observed statistics nonstationary. These statistical changes can be detected and used to reconstruct the distortion-causing field [25, 26].

# Integrated Sensing and Communication (ISAC): Evolution and Applications

## Background and Historical Development

The evolution of Integrated Sensing and Communication (ISAC) traces a fascinating trajectory through wireless technology development. Initially focused on achieving simultaneous communication and radar functions with an emphasis on radar sensing, ISAC has progressed through several key stages. These include the coexistence of communication and radar systems, radar-centric communication, and communication-centric radar, ultimately evolving into today's integrated systems.

## Current Significance and Applications

ISAC has emerged as a potential key technology for beyond-fifth-generation (B5G) and sixth-generation (6G) wireless communications, garnering significant attention from both academia and industry. Its dual-function capabilities offer two primary advantages:
- Shared wireless infrastructure, enhancing hardware utilization efficiency
- Integrated sensing capabilities that provide valuable environmental information

## Industrial Implementation and Standardization

The technology has gained substantial traction in the industrial sector:
- Major companies like Huawei and ZTE are developing ISAC for wireless network applications
- 3GPP SA1 has established research project TR 22.837 to explore use cases and requirements, with particular attention to security and privacy concerns

## Applications and Future Prospects

The dual-function design of communication and radar (DFRC) systems is particularly relevant for emerging services such as:
- Autonomous driving

# زيارة ترامب المفاجئة لأفغانستان وآفاق السلام مع طالبان

قام الرئيس الأمريكي دونالد ترامب بزيارة مفاجئة إلى أفغانستان بمناسبة عيد الشكر، حيث التقى بالقوات الأمريكية المتمركزة هناك والرئيس الأفغاني أشرف غني.

Here's the polished version of the text, maintaining its academic tone while improving clarity and flow:

Disinformation is proliferating across the internet, often driven by political agendas [1, 2]. In response, platforms have begun implementing warning systems to inform and guide users. Facebook pioneered this approach in December 2016 [3], followed by Google [4], Bing [5], and Twitter [6]. The implementation of these warnings has sparked significant public discourse, particularly after Twitter began flagging tweets from U.S. President Donald Trump in May 2020 [7]. However, current research provides limited evidence of these warnings' effectiveness in influencing user behavior or beliefs, leaving their utility in combating disinformation uncertain.

This challenge mirrors one faced by security researchers over a decade ago, when studies revealed that warnings about malware, phishing, and other online threats were largely ineffective [8, 9]. Through extensive, iterative research [10-21], security warnings have evolved to successfully guide user decisions and protect against harmful content [10, 17]. Our research applies these established security warning methodologies to develop and assess effective disinformation warnings.

A crucial insight from security research that we apply to disinformation is the superior effectiveness of interstitial warnings—which interrupt users and require interaction—compared to contextual warnings that neither interrupt nor demand action [8, 9, 17]. Our study represents the first evaluation of interstitial warnings in the context of disinformation.

We also incorporate the security field's robust evaluation methods, including structured models, realistic guided tasks, user interviews, and field studies [11, 13, 15-18]. These methodologies inform our empirical analysis of both contextual and interstitial disinformation warnings.

Our research encompasses two studies examining the following questions:

1. How frequently do users modify their behavior by seeking alternative information sources after encountering contextual and interstitial disinformation warnings?
2. What factors influence users' decisions to maintain their behavior despite these warnings?
3. Can highly informative interstitial warnings effectively alter user behavior?
4. Can threatening interstitial warnings effectively alter user behavior?

Our initial laboratory experiment (n = 40) observed participants conducting Google searches while encountering either interstitial or contextual warnings for specific results (Section 3). The interstitial warnings proved significantly more effective at influencing behavior, largely because users often overlooked or misunderstood the subtler contextual warnings. Post-task interviews revealed two key factors behind the interstitial warnings' effectiveness: clear, informative messaging and the perceived risk communicated through threatening design elements.

A subsequent crowdworker study (n = 238) evaluated eight interstitial warning designs (Section 4). This study confirmed the strong behavioral impact of interstitial warnings but surprisingly found that neither user comprehension nor perceived risk significantly moderated these effects.

Our findings demonstrate that interstitial disinformation warnings can successfully inform users and influence behavior. We present scalable, replicable methods for measuring warning effectiveness and testing effect theories. However, our research also reveals a potential concern: the behavioral impact of these warnings may stem more from user interface friction than informed decision-making. While our work establishes a foundation for designing effective warnings, we advocate for continued iterative research and refinement of disinformation warnings, following the successful model established by the information security community.

**The Hidden Dangers of Driverless Cars**

*CRASH! SCREECH!* That could be you in a self-driving car accident. Vehicle collisions remain alarmingly high in America, and many believe autonomous vehicles are the solution. However, self-driving cars may actually increase accident rates due to technological failures, limited reaction capabilities, and reduced driver awareness.

Today's technology, while impressive, remains fallible. Until autonomous systems achieve near-perfection, putting them in control of vehicles poses significant risks. Several states have wisely chosen not to allow or test driverless cars on their roads. Beyond simple malfunctions, these vehicles are vulnerable to cyber attacks, potentially allowing malicious actors to seize control remotely.

Consider the limitations of artificial reaction times. While human drivers must stay alert and responsive, they can process complex, unexpected scenarios in ways that autonomous systems cannot. For instance, if another vehicle spins out of control, a self-driving car—focused solely on reaching its programmed destination—may fail to respond appropriately. While technology offers many benefits, over-reliance on it in critical safety situations is dangerous.

Furthermore, drivers tend to become complacent in autonomous vehicles, paying less attention to their surroundings as they trust the system to handle everything. This creates additional risks. Consider practical limitations as well: when running late, you can't negotiate with a computer programmed to strictly observe speed limits.

# Peru Prosecutors Seek Extended Detention of Former President in Corruption Case

LIMA, Peru — Prosecutors have requested that former President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski remain in custody while investigators examine his alleged involvement in Latin America's largest corruption scandal.

On Monday morning, Deputy Prosecutor Hernan Mendoza argued for Kuczynski's continued detention, citing the need to investigate his alleged illicit activities during his tenure as a minister more than a decade ago.

The former Wall Street banker's presidency came to an end in 2018 when opposition lawmakers exposed that his private consulting firm had received previously undisclosed payments of $782,000 from Odebrecht, the Brazilian construction conglomerate. Odebrecht has since admitted to distributing nearly $800 million in bribes across Latin America to secure profitable public infrastructure contracts.

While Kuczynski maintains his innocence, he is currently serving a 10-day detention period as prosecutors investigate potential money laundering charges connected to two infrastructure projects.

# بنك مصر يوقع بروتوكول تعاون مع "ايتيدا" لتمويل الشركات التكنولوجية الصغيرة

## مقدمة
شهد قطاع الاتصالات وتكنولوجيا المعلومات المصري حدثاً هاماً بتوقيع بروتوكول تعاون بين بنك مصر وهيئة تنمية صناعة تكنولوجيا المعلومات "ايتيدا". وقد حضر التوقيع كل من عمرو طلعت، وزير الاتصالات وتكنولوجيا المعلومات، ومحمد الإتربي رئيس مجلس إدارة بنك مصر.

## أهداف البروتوكول
- إتاحة التمويل للشركات العاملة في مجال تكنولوجيا المعلومات والاتصالات
- تقديم قروض بسعر فائدة مخفض (5%) وفقاً لمبادرة البنك المركزي المصري
- تقديم دورات تدريبية في مجال ريادة الأعمال
- دعم الشركات الصغيرة والمتوسطة لتعزيز قدراتها التشغيلية

## آليات التنفيذ
ستقوم هيئة "ايتيدا" بـ:
- إعداد قائمة بالشركات الراغبة في التمويل
- مراجعة بيانات تسجيل الشركات
- تنظيم دورات تدريبية بالتعاون مع بنك مصر

## تصريحات المسؤولين
### عمرو طلعت - وزير الاتصالات:
أكد على الدور الحيوي للشركات الصغيرة والمتوسطة في التنمية الاقتصادية وخلق فرص العمل، مشيراً إلى أهمية توفير مناخ تمويلي مناسب.

### محمد الإتربي - رئيس مجلس إدارة بنك مصر:
أوضح أن البروتوكول يأتي في إطار دعم المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة عبر شبكة فروع البنك المنتشرة في مصر.

芬太尼致死案例在湾区激增（美联社）

近期湾区捷运（BART）系统内发生三起致命吸毒过量事件。尽管急救人员使用了逆转药物Narcan进行抢救，但三名患者最终仍不幸身亡。这些事件分别发生在阿拉米达县的佛利蒙、圣马刁县的德利市（Daly City）以及康曲柯士达县的快乐山（Pleasant Hill）。

据旧金山纪事报（Chronicle）分析加州卫生厅数据显示，除纳巴县外，湾区其余八县均受到芬太尼（fentanyl）危机的严重影响。在旧金山以外的地区，与芬太尼相关的致命案例呈现显著上升趋势。

2020年，加州因鸦片类药物过量死亡人数超过5000人，其中72%与芬太尼有关。旧金山的死亡率最高，每10万人中有49人死于鸦片类药物过量。

苏诺玛县自2018年起也面临类似危机。据该县卫生官员今年3月的报告，雷诺公园市（Rohnert Park）、圣他罗莎（Santa Rosa）和苏诺玛谷（Sonoma Valley）的30至40多岁人群中，药物过量情况尤为普遍。

旧金山加大研究员马尔斯（Sarah Mars）的研究表明，芬太尼的销售和使用形式多样，且常在使用者不知情的情况下与古柯碱或海洛英等其他药物混合。她强调："市面上流通的芬太尼假药含量往往远超标示剂量。"

数据分析显示，湾区鸦片类药物致死率在2010年代末期前相对稳定。2015年，芬太尼相关死亡仅占鸦片类药物死亡总数的8%，但到2020年，这一比例已激增至79%。

Here's a restructured version of the text with improved logical flow, moving from problem statement to solution and results:

Neural classifiers are vulnerable to adversarial attacks, producing unexpected predictions when subject to purposefully constructed human-imperceptible input perturbations and hence manifesting severe safety risks (Goodfellow et al., 2015; Madry et al., 2018). While existing methods for robust deep neural networks (Madry et al., 2018; Zhang et al., 2019) aim to address this issue, they often suffer from significant accuracy penalties on clean (unattacked) data (Tsipras et al., 2019; Zhang et al., 2019; Pang et al., 2022). As deep models continue to form the core of numerous products, trading clean accuracy for robustness is understandably unattractive for real-life users and profit-driven service providers. Consequently, despite continuous development in adversarial robustness research, robust models are rarely deployed and practical services remain non-robust (Ilyas et al., 2018; Borkar & Chen, 2021).

To bridge the gap between robustness research and applications, researchers have explored various approaches to reconcile robustness and accuracy (Balaji et al., 2019; Chen et al., 2020; Raghunathan et al., 2020; Rade & Moosavi-Dezfooli, 2021; Liu & Zhao, 2022; Pang et al., 2022; Cheng et al., 2022). Most works focused on improving robust training methods, which are expensive to implement and may be incompatible with each other. Moreover, these methods can be challenging to integrate into recent advancements in large-scale models pre-trained with large real or synthetic datasets. An alternative direction involves creating an ensemble of a standard (often non-robust) model and a robust model (Bai et al., 2023a; 2024), referred to as the mixed classifier.

Through observation of numerous existing models trained via different methods, we discovered that many robust base models share a benign confidence property: their correct predictions are much more confident than incorrect ones (Peng et al., 2023; Pang et al., 2022; Wang et al., 2023; Debenedetti et al., 2022; Na, 2020; Gowal et al., 2020; Liu et al., 2023; Singh et al., 2023). This observation suggests that strengthening this property could improve mixed classifiers' trade-off without altering the base classifiers' predicted classes.

Based on this intuition, we propose MixedNUTS (Mixed neUral classifiers with Nonlinear TranSformation), a training-free method that optimizes the mixed classifier's accuracy-robustness trade-off by enlarging the robust base classifier confidence difference between correct and incorrect predictions. MixedNUTS applies nonlinear transformations to the accurate and robust base classifiers' logits before converting them into probabilities used for mixing. The transformation is parameterized with only three coefficients and includes an efficient optimization algorithm. Unlike previous approaches, MixedNUTS neither modifies base neural network weights nor introduces additional components, making it efficiently extendable to larger datasets such as ImageNet. Furthermore, it remains compatible with various pre-trained standard and robust models while being agnostic to base model details such as training method, defense norm, training data, and model architecture.

Our experimental results, validated using AutoAttack (Croce & Hein, 2020) and strengthened adaptive attacks, demonstrate balanced accuracy and robustness across CIFAR-10, CIFAR-100, and ImageNet datasets. On CIFAR-100, MixedNUTS achieves a remarkable 7.86 percentage point improvement in clean accuracy compared to the state-of-the-art non-mixing robust model, while reducing robust accuracy by only 0.87 points. Notably, MixedNUTS is the first robust model to leverage larger pre-training datasets such as ImageNet-21k for ImageNet classification. Additionally, it offers the flexibility of inference-time adjustments between clean and adversarial accuracy.

# The Reality of Driverless Cars: Promise and Concerns

## Introduction
Driverless cars, vehicles capable of operating without human control, represent a significant technological advancement in transportation. While promising enhanced safety and efficiency, these autonomous vehicles also raise important concerns that warrant careful consideration.

## The Technology and Its Limitations
Despite technological progress, truly autonomous vehicles remain elusive. As noted in the article "Driverless Cars Are Coming," "none of the cars developed so far are completely driverless." Even Tesla's ambitious 2016 projection only promised autopilot functionality 90% of the time, highlighting the gap between the promise and reality of autonomous vehicles.

## Financial and Infrastructure Challenges
The implementation of driverless technology faces significant financial hurdles. These vehicles require extensive modifications to both cars and infrastructure. "For starters, they needed a whole lot of sensors," the article explains, indicating substantial costs for both manufacturers and consumers.

## Safety and Liability Concerns
A critical issue surrounding driverless cars is accountability in accidents. The article raises a pertinent question: "If technology fails and someone is injured, who is at fault—the driver or the manufacturer?" This uncertainty in liability creates legal and ethical challenges that need resolution.

## Impact on Driving Skills
One overlooked consequence is the potential loss of driving skills among the population. As autonomous vehicles become more prevalent, fewer people may learn traditional driving skills and road rules, potentially leading to increased risks when manual driving is necessary.

## Conclusion
While driverless cars offer potential benefits, significant challenges remain regarding their effectiveness, safety, cost, and societal impact. Until these concerns are adequately addressed, the widespread adoption of fully autonomous vehicles may be premature.

LINE 新功能：「聊天室表情符号」长按对话框即可送出六种可爱表情

如果你曾经使用过 LINE 社群，应该都体验过或看到过长按对话框即可发送表情符号的功能。这项功能让你可以针对特定的对话，使用不同的表情符号来简洁地表达自己的想法。现在，这个功能已经扩展到各种聊天室中，供更多用户使用！

这项「聊天室表情符号」功能在 iOS 与 Android 双平台均可使用。只要你的 LINE 版本是 11.11.0 或以上，就能通过长按对话框来选择想要使用的表情符号。如果你不确定自己的版本，可以直接更新至最新版本。

目前可选择的表情符号包括：点赞、爱心、笑脸、感动、哭泣和惊讶六种。
